sentences.zh: 自古受命帝王，曷嘗不封禪？

translations.literal: From ancient times receive mandate emperor kings, what time not feng shan?
translations.idiomatic: From ancient times, what emperor who received the mandate did not perform the feng and shan sacrifices?

sentences.zh: 蓋有無其應而用事者矣，未有睹符瑞見而不臻乎泰山者也。

translations.literal: Cover has without its response and use affairs, not has see auspicious signs appear and not reach to Mount Tai.
translations.idiomatic: There have been those who performed the rites without the proper omens, but never those who saw auspicious signs appear and did not proceed to Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 雖受命而功不至，至梁父矣而德不洽，洽矣而日有不暇給，是以即事用希。

translations.literal: Though receive mandate and merit not reach, reach Liang Fu and virtue not harmonize, harmonize and days have not leisure give, therefore undertake affairs use rare.
translations.idiomatic: Though they received the mandate, their achievements did not reach the required level; or reaching Liang Fu, their virtue was not in harmony; or being in harmony, they lacked the leisure time—so the rites were rarely performed.

sentences.zh: 傳曰：「三年不為禮，禮必廢；

translations.literal: Tradition says: 'three years not perform rites, rites must waste;
translations.idiomatic: The tradition says: 'Three years without performing the rites, the rites must fall into disuse;

sentences.zh: 三年不為樂，樂必壞。」

translations.literal: three years not perform music, music must ruin.'
translations.idiomatic: three years without performing music, the music must deteriorate.'

sentences.zh: 每世之隆，則封禪答焉，及衰而息。

translations.literal: Each generation's flourishing, then feng shan respond to it, and decline then cease.
translations.idiomatic: In each flourishing era, the feng and shan sacrifices respond to it; when it declines, they cease.

sentences.zh: 厥曠遠者千有餘載，近者數百載，故其儀闕然堙滅，其詳不可得而記聞云。

translations.literal: Its distant ones thousand remaining years, near ones several hundred years, therefore their rites gap then buried extinguish, their details cannot obtain and record hear say.
translations.idiomatic: The distant ones were over a thousand years ago, the nearer ones several hundred years ago—therefore their rites have gaps and are buried in oblivion; their details cannot be obtained and recorded, it is said.

translations.literal: Since ancient times, have the emperors and kings who received the mandate of heaven ever failed to perform the feng and shan sacrifices? There have been cases where they performed the rituals without receiving the appropriate omens, but never have there been cases where auspicious signs appeared and they did not proceed to Mount Tai. Even those who received the mandate but whose achievements were insufficient, or those who reached Mount Li but whose virtue was not all-encompassing, or those whose virtue was all-encompassing but who lacked sufficient time - these are the reasons why the rituals were performed rarely. The Classic says: 'If for three years the rites are not performed, the rites will surely be abolished; if for three years the music is not performed, the music will surely be ruined.' In times of flourishing dynasties, the feng and shan sacrifices respond accordingly; in times of decline, they cease. The longest gaps lasted over a thousand years, the shortest several hundred years, so their ceremonies have become lost and obscured, and their details can no longer be recorded or transmitted.

sentences.zh: 《尚書》曰，舜在璇璣玉衡，以齊七政。

translations.literal: Shang Shu says, Shun at Xuan Ji Yu Heng, with align seven governances.
translations.idiomatic: The Shang Shu says: Shun was at the Xuan Ji and Yu Heng, using them to align the seven governances.

sentences.zh: 遂類于上帝，禋于六宗，望山川，遍群神。

translations.literal: Then offer to Supreme Deity, yin to six ancestors, gaze mountains rivers, universal all spirits.
translations.idiomatic: Then he offered sacrifices to the Supreme Deity, made yin offerings to the six ancestors, gazed at the mountains and rivers, and universally to all spirits.

sentences.zh: 輯五瑞，擇吉月日，見四嶽諸牧，還瑞。

translations.literal: Collect five auspicious, select auspicious month day, see four peaks all shepherds, return auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: He collected the five auspicious tokens, selected auspicious months and days, met with the four peak lords and all the shepherds, and returned the auspicious tokens.

sentences.zh: 歲二月，東巡狩，至于岱宗。

translations.literal: Year second month, east inspection hunt, arrive at Dai Zong.
translations.idiomatic: In the year's second month, he conducted the eastern inspection tour, arriving at Dai Zong.

sentences.zh: 岱宗，泰山也。

translations.literal: Dai Zong, Mount Tai also.
translations.idiomatic: Dai Zong is Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 柴，望秩于山川。

translations.literal: Chai, gaze rank at mountains rivers.
translations.idiomatic: He performed the chai sacrifice, gazing in order at the mountains and rivers.

sentences.zh: 遂覲東后。

translations.literal: Then audience eastern lords.
translations.idiomatic: Then he held audience with the eastern lords.

sentences.zh: 東后者，諸侯也。

translations.literal: Eastern lords, feudal lords also.
translations.idiomatic: The eastern lords are the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 合時月正日，同律度量衡，修五禮，五玉三帛二生一死贄。

translations.literal: Harmonize seasons months first days, same pitch standards measures balances, repair five rites, five jades three silks two living one dead tribute.
translations.idiomatic: He harmonized the seasons, months, and first days; standardized the pitch pipes, measures, and balances; repaired the five rites; and prepared the five jades, three silks, two living animals, and one dead animal as tribute.

sentences.zh: 五月，巡狩至南嶽。

translations.literal: Fifth month, inspection hunt to south peak.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, he conducted the inspection tour to the southern peak.

sentences.zh: 南嶽，衡山也。

translations.literal: South peak, Heng Mountain also.
translations.idiomatic: The southern peak is Mount Heng.

sentences.zh: 八月，巡狩至西嶽。

translations.literal: Eighth month, inspection hunt to west peak.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, he conducted the inspection tour to the western peak.

sentences.zh: 西嶽，華山也。

translations.literal: West peak, Hua Mountain also.
translations.idiomatic: The western peak is Mount Hua.

sentences.zh: 十一月，巡狩至北嶽。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, inspection hunt to north peak.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, he conducted the inspection tour to the northern peak.

sentences.zh: 北岳，恒山也。

translations.literal: North peak, Heng Mountain also.
translations.idiomatic: The northern peak is Mount Heng.

sentences.zh: 皆如岱宗之禮。

translations.literal: All like Dai Zong's rites.
translations.idiomatic: All were performed according to Dai Zong's rites.

sentences.zh: 中嶽，嵩高也。

translations.literal: Middle peak, Song Gao also.
translations.idiomatic: The central peak is Mount Song Gao.

sentences.zh: 五載一巡狩。

translations.literal: Five years one inspection hunt.
translations.idiomatic: Once every five years he conducted the inspection tour.

translations.literal: The Classic says that Shun, using the jade disks and jade staff, aligned the seven celestial bodies. He then offered sacrifices to the Supreme Deity, made offerings to the Six Honored Ones, gazed upon the mountains and rivers, and paid respects to all the spirits. He gathered the five auspicious symbols, chose an auspicious month and day, met with the four mountain lords and the regional governors, and returned the symbols. In the second month, he toured the east, arriving at Mount Dai. Mount Dai is Mount Tai. He made burnt offerings and gazed in order upon the mountains and rivers. He then held court with the eastern lords. The eastern lords were the feudal lords. He harmonized the seasons, months, and days; unified the pitch pipes, measures, and weights; and refined the five rites with five jades, three silks, two living creatures, and one dead offering. In the fifth month, he toured to the southern peak. The southern peak is Mount Heng. In the eighth month, he toured to the western peak. The western peak is Mount Hua. In the eleventh month, he toured to the northern peak. The northern peak is Mount Heng. All followed the same rituals as at Mount Dai. The central peak is Mount Song. He toured once every five years.

sentences.zh: 禹遵之。

translations.literal: Yu followed it.
translations.idiomatic: Yu followed this practice.

sentences.zh: 後十四世，至帝孔甲，淫德好神，神瀆，二龍去之。

translations.literal: After fourteen generations, to Emperor Kong Jia, licentious virtue fond spirits, spirits profane, two dragons leave him.
translations.idiomatic: Fourteen generations later, Emperor Kong Jia had licentious virtue and was fond of spirits; he profaned the spirits, so the two dragons left him.

sentences.zh: 其後三世，湯伐桀，欲遷夏社，不可，作夏社。

translations.literal: Its after three generations, Tang attacked Jie, wished move Xia altar, not possible, made Xia altar.
translations.idiomatic: Three generations later, Tang attacked Jie; he wished to move the Xia altar but it was not possible, so he made a Xia altar.

sentences.zh: 後八世，至帝太戊，有桑谷生於廷，一暮大拱，懼。

translations.literal: After eight generations, to Emperor Tai Wu, had mulberry grain grow at court, one evening greatly embrace, fear.
translations.idiomatic: Eight generations later, Emperor Tai Wu had mulberry and grain growing in his court; in one evening they grew to embrace each other greatly, causing fear.

sentences.zh: 伊陟曰：「妖不勝德。」

translations.literal: Yi Zhi said: 'Demon not overcome virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Yi Zhi said: 'Demons cannot overcome virtue.'

sentences.zh: 太戊修德，桑谷死。

translations.literal: Tai Wu cultivated virtue, mulberry grain died.
translations.idiomatic: Tai Wu cultivated virtue, and the mulberry and grain died.

sentences.zh: 伊陟贊巫咸，巫咸之興自此始。

translations.literal: Yi Zhi assisted Wu Xian, Wu Xian's rise from this began.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Zhi assisted Wu Xian, and Wu Xian's rise began from this.

sentences.zh: 後十四世，帝武丁得傅說為相，殷復興焉，稱高宗。

translations.literal: After fourteen generations, Emperor Wu Ding obtained Fu Yue as minister, Yin revived thereupon, called Gao Zong.
translations.idiomatic: Fourteen generations later, Emperor Wu Ding obtained Fu Yue as his minister; Yin was revived thereupon, and he was called Gao Zong.

sentences.zh: 有雉登鼎耳雊，武丁懼。

translations.literal: Had pheasant ascend cauldron ears crow, Wu Ding feared.
translations.idiomatic: A pheasant ascended the cauldron's ears and crowed; Wu Ding was afraid.

sentences.zh: 祖己曰：「修德。」

translations.literal: Zu Ji said: 'Cultivate virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Zu Ji said: 'Cultivate virtue.'

sentences.zh: 武丁從之，位以永寧。

translations.literal: Wu Ding followed it, position with eternal peace.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ding followed this advice, and his position was eternally peaceful.

sentences.zh: 後五世，帝武乙慢神而震死。

translations.literal: After five generations, Emperor Wu Yi disrespected spirits and thunder died.
translations.idiomatic: Five generations later, Emperor Wu Yi disrespected the spirits and was killed by thunder.

sentences.zh: 後三世，帝紂淫亂，武王伐之。

translations.literal: After three generations, Emperor Zhou licentious chaos, Wu Wang attacked him.
translations.idiomatic: Three generations later, Emperor Zhou was licentious and chaotic; Wu Wang attacked him.

sentences.zh: 由此觀之，始未嘗不肅祗，後稍怠慢也。

translations.literal: From this observe, beginning not ever not solemn respectful, later somewhat negligent also.
translations.idiomatic: From this we can see that at the beginning they were never not solemn and respectful, but later they became somewhat negligent.

translations.literal: Yu followed these practices. Fourteen generations later, during the reign of Emperor Kong Jia, his virtue became decadent and he favored spirits excessively, so the spirits abandoned him, and two dragons departed. Three generations later, Tang attacked Jie and wanted to move the Xia altar, but it could not be moved, so he created a Xia altar. Eight generations later, during the reign of Emperor Tai Wu, a mulberry tree and a grain plant grew in the courtyard, growing to the size of a large embrace overnight, which frightened him. Yi Zhi said: 'Monsters cannot overcome virtue.' Tai Wu cultivated virtue, and the mulberry and grain died. Yi Zhi praised Wu Xian, and Wu Xian's rise began from this time. Fourteen generations later, Emperor Wu Ding obtained Fu Yue as his chancellor, and Yin was revived, and he was called Gao Zong. A pheasant perched on the cauldron's handle and crowed, which frightened Wu Ding. Zu Ji said: 'Cultivate virtue.' Wu Ding followed this advice, and his position was permanently secure. Five generations later, Emperor Wu Yi offended the spirits and was killed by lightning. Three generations later, Emperor Zhou was decadent and chaotic, and King Wu attacked him. From this we can see that at the beginning they were never irreverent toward the spirits, but later they gradually became negligent.

sentences.zh: 周官曰，冬日至，祀天於南郊，迎長日之至；

translations.literal: Zhou officials say, winter solstice arrive, sacrifice heaven at south suburb, welcome long day arrive;
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou officials say: when the winter solstice arrives, sacrifice to heaven at the southern suburb, welcoming the arrival of longer days;

sentences.zh: 夏日至，祭地祗。

translations.literal: Summer solstice arrive, sacrifice earth spirits.
translations.idiomatic: when the summer solstice arrives, sacrifice to the earth spirits.

sentences.zh: 皆用樂舞，而神乃可得而禮也。

translations.literal: All use music dance, and spirits then can obtain and rite also.
translations.idiomatic: All use music and dance, and only then can the spirits be obtained and properly ritualized.

sentences.zh: 天子祭天下名山大川，五嶽視三公，四瀆視諸侯，諸侯祭其疆內名山大川。

translations.literal: Son of heaven sacrifices all under heaven famous mountains great rivers, five peaks regard three dukes, four rivers regard feudal lords, feudal lords sacrifice their territory within famous mountains great rivers.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven sacrifices to all the famous mountains and great rivers under heaven: the five peaks are treated like the three dukes; the four rivers are treated like the feudal lords; the feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their territories.

sentences.zh: 四瀆者，江、河、淮、濟也。

translations.literal: Four rivers, Jiang, He, Huai, Ji also.
translations.idiomatic: The four rivers are the Jiang, He, Huai, and Ji.

sentences.zh: 天子曰明堂、辟雍，諸侯曰泮宮。

translations.literal: Son of heaven called Bright Hall, Pi Yong, feudal lords called Pan Palace.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven calls them the Bright Hall and Pi Yong; the feudal lords call them the Pan Palace.

translations.literal: The Zhou officials said that on the winter solstice, they sacrificed to heaven in the southern suburbs to welcome the lengthening days; on the summer solstice, they sacrificed to the earth spirits. They all used music and dance, and only then could the spirits be approached and the rites performed. The Son of Heaven sacrificed to the famous mountains and great rivers of the realm. The Five Peaks were treated like the Three Dukes, the Four Rivers like the feudal lords, and the feudal lords sacrificed to the famous mountains and great rivers within their territories. The Four Rivers are the Yangtze, Yellow River, Huai, and Ji. The Son of Heaven called it the Bright Hall and the Universal School, the feudal lords called it the Half Moon Palace.

sentences.zh: 周公既相成王，郊祀后稷以配天，宗祀文王於明堂以配上帝。

translations.literal: Duke Zhou already assisted Cheng Wang, suburb sacrifice Hou Ji with match heaven, ancestral sacrifice Wen Wang at Bright Hall with match Supreme Deity.
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Zhou assisted Cheng Wang, he performed the suburban sacrifice to Hou Ji to match with Heaven, and the ancestral sacrifice to Wen Wang in the Bright Hall to match with the Supreme Deity.

sentences.zh: 自禹興而修社祀，后稷稼穡，故有稷祠，郊社所從來尚矣。

translations.literal: From Yu rose and repaired altar sacrifices, Hou Ji farming harvest, therefore have Ji temple, suburb altar where from come ancient already.
translations.idiomatic: Since Yu rose and repaired the altar sacrifices, and Hou Ji handled farming and harvesting, therefore there is the Ji temple; the suburban and altar sacrifices have come from ancient times.

translations.literal: After the Duke of Zhou assisted King Cheng, he performed suburban sacrifices to Hou Ji to match heaven, and ancestral sacrifices to King Wen in the Bright Hall to match the Supreme Deity. Since Yu rose and established the altar sacrifices, and Hou Ji farmed, there were grain sacrifices, and the origins of suburban and altar sacrifices go back to ancient times.

sentences.zh: 自周克殷後十四世，世益衰，禮樂廢，諸侯恣行，而幽王為犬戎所敗，周東徙雒邑。

translations.literal: From Zhou conquered Yin after fourteen generations, generations increasingly decline, rites music waste, feudal lords unrestrained conduct, and You Wang by Quan Rong defeated, Zhou east moved Luo city.
translations.idiomatic: From Zhou's conquest of Yin, after fourteen generations, each generation increasingly declined; rites and music were wasted; feudal lords conducted themselves unrestrainedly; You Wang was defeated by the Quan Rong; Zhou moved east to Luo city.

sentences.zh: 秦襄公攻戎救周，始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin Xiang Gong attacked Rong saved Zhou, began ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Xiang Gong attacked the Rong to save Zhou, and began to be ranked among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 秦襄公既侯，居西垂，自以為主少皞之神，作西畤，祠白帝，其牲用騮駒黃牛羝羊各一云。

translations.literal: Qin Xiang Gong already marquis, dwelt west border, self considered master Shao Hao's spirit, made west zhi, sacrificed White Emperor, its sacrificial animals used sorrel colt yellow ox ram sheep each one says.
translations.idiomatic: After Qin Xiang Gong became marquis and dwelt on the western border, he considered himself master of Shao Hao's spirit, made the western zhi altar, sacrificed to the White Emperor, using as sacrificial animals one sorrel colt, one yellow ox, and one ram sheep each, it is said.

sentences.zh: 其後十六年，秦文公東獵汧渭之閒，卜居之而吉。

translations.literal: Its after sixteen years, Qin Wen Gong east hunted Qian Wei between, divined dwelling it and auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Sixteen years later, Qin Wen Gong went east hunting between the Qian and Wei rivers; he divined about dwelling there and it was auspicious.

sentences.zh: 文公夢黃蛇自天下屬地，其口止於鄜衍。

translations.literal: Wen Gong dreamed yellow snake from heaven descended earth, its mouth stopped at Fu Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Gong dreamed of a yellow snake descending from heaven to earth, its mouth stopping at Fu Yan.

sentences.zh: 文公問史敦，敦曰：「此上帝之徵，君其祠之。」

translations.literal: Wen Gong asked Shi Dun, Dun said: 'This Supreme Deity's omen, lord should sacrifice it.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Gong asked Shi Dun, who said: 'This is an omen from the Supreme Deity; my lord should sacrifice to it.'

sentences.zh: 於是作鄜畤，用三牲郊祭白帝焉。

translations.literal: Thereupon made Fu zhi, used three sacrificial animals suburb sacrificed White Emperor there.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he made the Fu zhi altar, using three sacrificial animals to perform the suburban sacrifice to the White Emperor.

translations.literal: After the Zhou conquered Yin, fourteen generations passed, and the dynasty gradually declined. Rites and music were abandoned, the feudal lords acted wantonly, and King You was defeated by the Dog Rong, so the Zhou moved east to Luoyi. Duke Xiang of Qin attacked the Rong to save Zhou, and began to be ranked among the feudal lords. After Duke Xiang of Qin became a feudal lord, he resided in the western frontier. Considering himself the descendant of Shaohao's spirit, he built the Western Altar, sacrificing to the White Emperor, using a sorrel horse, yellow ox, and ram as offerings. Sixteen years later, Duke Wen of Qin hunted east between the Qian and Wei rivers, and divination showed it was auspicious to settle there. Duke Wen dreamed of a yellow serpent descending from heaven to earth, its mouth stopping at Fu Yan. Duke Wen asked Shi Dun, who said: 'This is an omen from the Supreme Deity. Your lordship should sacrifice to it.' Therefore he built the Fu Altar, using the three sacrificial animals to perform suburban sacrifices to the White Emperor.

sentences.zh: 自未作鄜畤也，而雍旁故有吳陽武畤，雍東有好畤，皆廢無祠。

translations.literal: From not yet made Fu zhi, and Yong beside originally had Wu Yang Wu zhi, Yong east had Hao zhi, all abandoned no sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Before the Fu zhi was made, beside Yong there were originally the Wu Yang Wu zhi and east of Yong the Hao zhi, but all were abandoned without sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 或曰：「自古以雍州積高，神明之隩，故立畤郊上帝，諸神祠皆聚云。

translations.literal: Some said: 'From ancient times with Yong province piled high, spirits bright recess, therefore established zhi suburb Supreme Deity, various spirits sacrifices all gathered cloud.
translations.idiomatic: Some say: 'From ancient times, Yong province has been piled high, a recess for spirits and brightness; therefore the zhi altars were established to suburb-sacrifice the Supreme Deity, and all the various spirit sacrifices gathered there as clouds.

sentences.zh: 蓋黃帝時嘗用事，雖晚周亦郊焉。」

translations.literal: Cover Yellow Emperor time once used affairs, though late Zhou also suburb there.'
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor once used these affairs, and even late Zhou also performed the suburban sacrifices there.'

sentences.zh: 其語不經見，縉紳者不道。

translations.literal: Its words not classics seen, officials not speak.
translations.idiomatic: These words are not seen in the classics; officials do not speak of them.

translations.literal: Before building the Fu Altar, there were already the Wu Yang Wu Altar beside Yong, and the Hao Altar east of Yong, but all were abandoned without sacrifices. Some say: 'Since ancient times, Yong province has accumulated height and is a secluded place for spirits, so altars were established to sacrifice to the Supreme Deity, and all the spirit sacrifices were gathered there. It is said that during the Yellow Emperor's time they performed the rituals, and even in the late Zhou they performed suburban sacrifices.' These words are not found in the classics, and the educated do not discuss them.

sentences.zh: 作鄜畤後九年，文公獲若石雲，于陳倉北阪城祠之。

translations.literal: Made Fu zhi after nine years, Wen Gong obtained like stone cloud, at Chen Cang north slope walled sacrificed it.
translations.idiomatic: Nine years after making the Fu zhi, Wen Gong obtained something like a stone cloud; he walled it at the north slope of Chen Cang and sacrificed to it.

sentences.zh: 其神或歲不至，或歲數來，來也常以夜，光輝若流星，從東南來集于祠城，則若雄雞，其聲殷雲，野雞夜雊。

translations.literal: Its spirit sometimes year not arrive, sometimes year several come, come also constantly with night, radiance like shooting star, from southeast come gather at sacrifice walled, crow like male chicken, its sound rumbling cloud, wild chickens night crow.
translations.idiomatic: Its spirit sometimes did not arrive for a year, sometimes came several times a year; when it came it was always at night, radiant like a shooting star, coming from the southeast to gather at the sacrificial walled area, crowing like a male chicken with a rumbling sound like thunder, and wild chickens crowing at night.

sentences.zh: 以一牢祠，命曰陳寶。

translations.literal: With one pen sacrificed, named Chen Bao.
translations.idiomatic: He sacrificed with one pen of sacrificial animals, naming it Chen Bao.

translations.literal: Nine years after building the Fu Altar, Duke Wen obtained a stone like clouds at Chen Cang's northern slope and built a city to sacrifice to it. Its spirit sometimes did not come for a year, sometimes came several times. When it came, it was always at night, its brilliance like a shooting star, coming from the southeast to gather at the sacrificial city, making sounds like a male pheasant, with a resounding echo like wild chickens crowing at night. He sacrificed with one pen of animals, naming it Chen Bao.

sentences.zh: 作鄜畤後七十八年，秦德公既立，卜居雍，「後子孫飲馬於河」，遂都雍。

translations.literal: Made Fu zhi after seventy eight years, Qin De Gong already established, divined dwelling Yong, 'later descendants drink horses at river', then capitaled Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Seventy-eight years after making the Fu zhi, Qin De Gong was already established; he divined about dwelling in Yong: 'Later descendants will drink their horses at the river,' and then made Yong his capital.

sentences.zh: 雍之諸祠自此興。

translations.literal: Yong's various sacrifices from this rose.
translations.idiomatic: Yong's various sacrifices rose from this.

sentences.zh: 用三百牢於鄜畤。

translations.literal: Used three hundred pens at Fu zhi.
translations.idiomatic: He used three hundred pens of sacrificial animals at the Fu zhi.

sentences.zh: 作伏祠。

translations.literal: Made hidden sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: He made the hidden sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 磔狗邑四門，以御蠱菑。

translations.literal: Torn dogs walled four gates, to resist poison calamities.
translations.idiomatic: He had dogs torn apart and walled them at the four gates, to resist poison and calamities.

translations.literal: Seventy-eight years after building the Fu Altar, Duke De of Qin ascended the throne. He divined about settling in Yong: 'Later generations will drink horses at the river,' so he moved the capital to Yong. The various sacrifices of Yong flourished from this time. He used three hundred pens of animals at the Fu Altar. He established the Hidden Sacrifice. He tore dogs at the four gates of the city to ward off calamities.

sentences.zh: 德公立二年卒。

translations.literal: De Gong established second year died.
translations.idiomatic: De Gong died in his second year of rule.

sentences.zh: 其後（六）［四］年，秦宣公作密畤於渭南，祭青帝。

translations.literal: Its after four years, Qin Xuan Gong made Mi zhi at Wei south, sacrificed Green Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Four years later, Qin Xuan Gong made the Mi zhi altar south of the Wei River, sacrificing to the Green Emperor.

translations.literal: Duke De died in his second year. Four years later, Duke Xuan of Qin built the Mi Altar south of the Wei River, sacrificing to the Blue Emperor.

sentences.zh: 其後十四年，秦繆公立，病臥五日不寤；

I have assembled chariots three times, assembled carriages six times, united the feudal lords nine times, corrected the realm once, and no feudal lord dares disobey me. How is this different from when the Three Dynasties received the mandate?' Therefore Guan Zhong, seeing that Duke Huan could not be persuaded with words, set forth practical reasons, saying: 'The ancient feng and shan sacrifices used millet from Xiang Shang, grain from Bei Li, which served as the abundance; between the Yangtze and Huai rivers, one thatched hut with three ridges, which served as the mat. The Eastern Sea brought forth the fish with united eyes, the Western Sea brought forth the birds with united wings, and then there were fifteen things that came without being summoned. Now phoenixes and unicorns do not come, auspicious grains do not grow, but thorns and brambles flourish, owls appear frequently, and yet you wish to perform feng and shan - is this not impossible?' sentences.zh: 始皇之上泰山，中阪遇暴風雨，休於大樹下。

translations.idiomatic: When Shi Huang ascended Tai Mountain, on the middle slope he encountered violent wind and rain, and rested beneath a large tree.

translations.literal: Various Confucian scholars already dismissed, could not participate use in feng affairs rites, heard Shi Huang encountered wind rain, then ridiculed it.
translations.idiomatic: The various Confucian scholars had already been dismissed and could not participate in the feng rites; when they heard Shi Huang encountered wind and rain, they ridiculed him.

translations.literal: When Shi Huang ascended Mount Tai, midway he encountered violent wind and rain, and rested under a large tree. The Confucian scholars, having been dismissed, could not participate in the feng sacrifice rituals. Hearing that Shi Huang encountered wind and rain, they mocked him.

sentences.zh: 於是始皇遂東遊海上，行禮祠名山大川及八神，求僊人羨門之屬。

translations.literal: Thereupon Shi Huang then east toured on sea, performed rites sacrificed famous mountains great rivers and eight spirits, sought immortals Xian Men kind.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Shi Huang toured east along the sea, performed rites and sacrificed to famous mountains, great rivers, and the eight spirits, seeking immortals and those of Xian Men's kind.

sentences.zh: 齊所以為齊，以天齊也。

translations.idiomatic: Qi is called Qi because of the heavenly Qi.

translations.idiomatic: Its sacrifices have ceased; no one knows when they began.

translations.idiomatic: The eight spirits: first, the heaven lord, sacrificed to at heaven Qi.

translations.literal: Heaven Qi deep water, dwelt Lin Zi south suburb mountain below.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven Qi is the deep water that dwells below the mountain in Lin Zi's southern suburb.

translations.literal: Two said earth lord, sacrificed Tai Mountain Liang Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Second, the earth lord, sacrificed to at Tai Mountain Liang Fu.

sentences.zh: 蓋天好陰，祠之必於高山之下，小山之上，命曰「畤」；

translations.literal: Cover heaven likes yin, sacrifice it must at high mountain below, small mountain above, named 'zhi';
translations.idiomatic: Heaven likes yin; sacrifice to it must be below high mountains and above small mountains; it is called a 'zhi';

sentences.zh: 地貴陽，祭之必於澤中圜丘云。

translations.idiomatic: Third, the war lord, sacrificed to Chi You.

translations.literal: Chi You at Dong Ping Lu Jian xiang, Qi's west border also.
translations.idiomatic: Chi You is at Dong Ping Lu Jian xiang, on Qi's western border.

translations.literal: Therefore Shi Huang then toured east to the sea, performing rituals and sacrifices to famous mountains, great rivers, and the eight spirits, seeking immortals and the like of Xianmen. The eight spirits have existed since ancient times, some say they were created since the time of Tai Gong. What makes Qi Qi is the heavenly Qi. When its sacrifices ceased, no one knows when they began. The eight spirits: the first is the Heaven Lord, sacrificing to Tian Qi. Tian Qi is a deep pool, located below the mountain in the southern suburbs of Linzi. The second is the Earth Lord, sacrificing at Mount Tai and Mount Li. Heaven prefers shade, so sacrifices to it must be at the foot of high mountains and on top of small mountains, called 'zhi'; earth prefers sunlight, so sacrifices to it must be in round mounds in marshes. The third is the War Lord, sacrificing to Chi You. Chi You is in Dongping Lu Jian Township, the western border of Qi. The fourth is the Yin Lord, sacrificing to the Three Mountains. The fifth is the Yang Lord, sacrificing at Fu. The sixth is the Moon Lord, sacrificing at Mount Lai. All are north of Qi, bordering the Bohai Sea. The seventh is the Sun Lord, sacrificing at Mount Cheng. Mount Cheng thrusts into the sea, located at the northeastern corner of Qi, to welcome the sunrise. The eighth is the Four Seasons Lord, sacrificing at Langye. Langye is in the eastern part of Qi, probably where the year begins. All use one set of sacrificial animals for each sacrifice, but the shamans and invokers made additions and subtractions, with varying jade and silk offerings.

sentences.zh: 自齊威、宣之時，騶子之徒論著終始五德之運，及秦帝而齊人奏之，故始皇采用之。

translations.literal: From the time of Duke Wei and Duke Xuan of Qi, Zou Zi's followers discussed and wrote about the cycles of the beginning and end of the five virtues. When Qin became emperor, the Qi people presented it, so Shi Huang adopted it. Song Wuji, Zheng Boqiao, Chong Shang, Xianmen Gao were the last, all Yan people, practicing the way of immortals, bodily dissolution and transformation, relying on the affairs of ghosts and spirits. Zou Yan became prominent among the feudal lords by mastering yin and yang, and the magicians along the Qi and Yan coasts transmitted his techniques but could not master them thoroughly. Nevertheless, the strange, far-fetched, flattering, and compromising followers arose from this, too numerous to count.

translations.idiomatic: Five years later, Shi Huang went south to Xiang Mountain, then ascended Kui Ji, traveled along the seaside, hoping to encounter the strange medicines of the three spirit mountains in the sea.

sentences.zh: 不得，還至沙丘崩。

translations.literal: Not obtain, returned to Sha Qiu collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: Not obtaining them, he returned to Sha Qiu and collapsed.

translations.literal: From the time of Wei, Xuan, and Yan Zhao, they sent people into the sea to seek Penglai, Fangzhang, and Yingzhou. These three divine mountains, according to tradition, are in the Bohai Sea, not far from people; but when about to arrive, the wind blows the ships away. It is said that those who have reached them find immortals and medicines of immortality there. Their birds and beasts are all white, and palaces are made of gold and silver. Before arriving, they appear like clouds; when arriving, the three divine mountains sink below the water. When approaching them, the wind always blows them away, and in the end no one can reach them. Every ruler has been devoted to them. When Qin Shi Huang unified the realm and reached the sea, the magicians' words were too numerous to count. Shi Huang considered himself to have reached the sea but feared he might not reach the mountains, so he sent people carrying boys and girls into the sea to seek them. The ships met in the sea, all using wind as an excuse, saying they could not reach them but had glimpsed them. The next year, Shi Huang toured the sea again, reaching Langye, passing Mount Heng, returning from Shangdang. Three years later, he toured Mount Jie, examined the sea-going magicians, returned from Shang Commandery. Five years later, Shi Huang went south to Mount Xiang, then ascended Mount Kuaiji, toured along the sea, hoping to encounter the marvelous medicines of the three divine mountains in the sea. He did not obtain them, and on his return he collapsed at Shaqiu.

translations.idiomatic: In Er Shi's first year, he toured east to Jie Shi, traveled along the south of the Hai, passed Tai Mountain, arrived at Kui Ji, performed ritual sacrifices to all of them, and carved alongside the stone writings that Shi Huang had established, to display Shi Huang's merits and virtues.

translations.idiomatic: That autumn, the feudal lords rebelled against Qin.

translations.literal: In the first year of the Second Emperor, he toured east to Mount Jie, toured south of the sea, passed Mount Tai, reached Mount Kuaiji, all performing rituals and sacrifices, and carved beside the stone inscriptions Shi Huang had erected, to proclaim Shi Huang's achievements and virtue. That autumn, the feudal lords rebelled against Qin. After three years, the Second Emperor was assassinated and died.

translations.idiomatic: Twelve years after Shi Huang's feng and shan, Qin perished.

translations.literal: Various Confucian scholars hated Qin burned poems books, executed punished literature, common people resented its laws, all under heaven rebelled it, all falsely said: 'Shi Huang ascended Tai Mountain, struck by violent wind rain, could not obtain feng shan.'
translations.idiomatic: The various Confucian scholars hated that Qin burned the poems and books, executed and punished the literati; the common people resented its laws; all under heaven rebelled against it; all falsely claimed: 'Shi Huang ascended Tai Mountain, was struck by violent wind and rain, could not obtain the feng and shan.'

translations.idiomatic: Was this not what is called performing the rites without the proper virtue?

translations.literal: Twelve years after Shi Huang's feng and shan sacrifices, Qin perished. The Confucian scholars resented Qin for burning the poems and books, slaughtering the literati, and the people resented their laws, so the realm rebelled against them, all falsely saying: 'Shi Huang ascended Mount Tai, was struck by violent wind and rain, could not perform the feng and shan.' Is this not what is called performing the rituals without possessing virtue?

sentences.zh: 昔三代之（君）［居］皆在河洛之閒，故嵩高為中嶽，而四嶽各如其方，四瀆咸在山東。

translations.literal: Former three dynasties residences all in He Luo between, therefore Song Gao for central peak, and four peaks each like their direction, four rivers all in Shan Dong.
translations.idiomatic: The residences of the former three dynasties were all between the He and Luo rivers; therefore Song Gao was the central peak, and the four peaks were each in their proper directions, with the four rivers all east of the mountains.

translations.idiomatic: When Qin became emperor and made Xian Yang its capital, then the five peaks and four rivers were all together in the east.

translations.literal: From five emperors to Qin, intermittently rose intermittently declined, famous mountains great rivers sometimes in feudal lords, sometimes in Son of Heaven, their rites diminished increased generations different, cannot win record.
translations.idiomatic: From the five emperors to Qin, they intermittently rose and declined; famous mountains and great rivers were sometimes under feudal lords, sometimes under the Son of Heaven; their rites were diminished or increased, differing by generations, and cannot all be recorded.

sentences.zh: 及秦并天下，令祠官所常奉天地名山大川鬼神可得而序也。

translations.literal: And Qin united all under heaven, commanded sacrifice officials what constantly offered heaven earth famous mountains great rivers ghosts spirits can obtain and order also.
translations.idiomatic: When Qin united all under heaven, it commanded the sacrifice officials to constantly offer to heaven, earth, famous mountains, great rivers, and ghosts and spirits, which could be obtained and ordered.

translations.literal: In ancient times, the capitals of the Three Dynasties were all between the Yellow River and Luo River, so Mount Song was the central peak, and the four peaks were each in their directions, and the four rivers were all east of the mountains. When Qin declared itself emperor and made Xianyang the capital, then the five peaks and four rivers were all in the east. From the Five Emperors to Qin, dynasties rose and declined alternately, famous mountains and great rivers were sometimes in the feudal lords' territories, sometimes in the Son of Heaven's domain, their rituals increased and decreased with each generation, impossible to record completely. When Qin unified the realm, they ordered the sacrificial officials to constantly maintain the sacrifices to heaven, earth, famous mountains, great rivers, and ghosts and spirits that could be properly ordered.
